channel.title: Single player Runescape Classic (discussion)
channel.description:
I had the idea of a new venture for rsc, no more reliant on players but really just development. Basicly just something to discuss and hopefully find some people who have an interest in it.
Generally it would be based around quests, final bosses in which would provide combat level bonus's and unlock items. Definately something to provide a new perspective of the game.
What kind of opinions and idea's do you guys have about such a venture? I would think that you wouldn't need to max out 123 combat to finish the game, but it would certainly require a high combat and alot of gaming time, but not as much as the normal experience rates would take up.
Expensive hosting wouldn't be an issue anymore and money could be made from either donations or just advertisements.
-Sexymapu

item.title: Single player Runescape Classic (discussion)
item.dc:creator: @Erj Erj
item.description:
@Erj wrote:

What about if we pulled some coop kind of thing also, that might be a win.

Read full topic

item.title: Single player Runescape Classic (discussion)
item.dc:creator: @Old_Rsc_Player Old Rsc Player
item.description:
@Old_Rsc_Player wrote:

Single player rsc, could actually work, make it where players can play “offline” and dont have to connect to the server, and can do the quests/game story. Then when they want to go online, they can do so as well.

So single player + Multiplayer? But with the option to go single…

There was a game before that I played, that used this technique, and was quite sucessful.

Read full topic

item.title: Single player Runescape Classic (discussion)
item.dc:creator: @mapu mapu
item.description:
@mapu wrote:

[quote=“The_AFKer, post:11, topic:323357”][quote author=mapu link=topic=419759.msg3088407#msg3088407 date=1262676533]
It would mean we are no longer be playing rsc, which would mean it would have no relevance to moparscape or even the rsc community in general.
[/quote]

The RSC engine was built for multiplayer purposes (MMORPG), completely eliminating it to a single player would cripple gameplay in itself, and as Stork stated “become repetative”.

You would be better off leaving it alone my friend.[/quote]
I will kill you bitch.

Read full topic

item.title: Single player Runescape Classic (discussion)
item.dc:creator: @Erj Erj
item.description:
@Erj wrote:

[quote=“The_AFKer, post:11, topic:323357”][quote author=mapu link=topic=419759.msg3088407#msg3088407 date=1262676533]
It would mean we are no longer be playing rsc, which would mean it would have no relevance to moparscape or even the rsc community in general.
[/quote]

The RSC engine was built for multiplayer purposes (MMORPG), completely eliminating it to a single player would cripple gameplay in itself, and as Stork stated “become repetative”.

You would be better off leaving it alone my friend.[/quote]
Exactly my point.If we’re going to create a single player rsc, it cannot be all original. Something has to go; imo the engine.

Read full topic

and then it would no longer use copy written intellectual property for a game client… would mean you could legally charge players money for access to the game

item.title: Single player Runescape Classic (discussion)
item.dc:creator: @mapu mapu
item.description:
@mapu wrote:

Erj:

Take the rsc engine throw it away. Keep the items and stats and revamp it a new.

Then we would have a completely different game…

item.title: Single player Runescape Classic (discussion)
item.dc:creator: @Old_Rsc_Player Old Rsc Player
item.description:
@Old_Rsc_Player wrote:

Your going to need a hard core story line to keep people interested. (the challenge they overcome)

Read full topic

item.title: Single player Runescape Classic (discussion)
item.dc:creator: @mapu mapu
item.description:
@mapu wrote:

The grind aspect would be the challenge you need to overcome. Xp rates and training techniques would need to be opened up to less repetition. Unlocking parts of the world as you level up.

“Slayer-like” techniques could be used for more interesting training and reap prizes/unlock items at the same time.

Read full topic

item.title: Single player Runescape Classic (discussion)
item.dc:creator: @Old_Rsc_Player Old Rsc Player
item.description:
@Old_Rsc_Player wrote:

I think a one life rsc would be awesome and bring something new and unique to the game, defiantly would give it a shot but wouldnt keep interest in it after I go through 2-3 accounts.

Read full topic

item.title: Single player Runescape Classic (discussion)
item.dc:creator: @darscape darscape
item.description:
@darscape wrote:

Come play my servers, you’ll have unlimited single player!

item.title: Single player Runescape Classic (discussion)
item.dc:creator: @Stork Stork
item.description:
@Stork wrote:

Single player games rely on new content and storyline, not repetitive gameplay like rsc is designed for. It’d be difficult to make anyone want to play a grinding game like rsc as single player.

Read full topic
